events.name: score_tally
events.comment: total score throughout the ENTIRE game

events.name: timer
events.comment: timer for the question & answer portion

events.name: finishLimit
events.comment: the amount of questions/interactivity (this includes d&d oso)

events.name: current_question
events.comment: which question is the user on? Q&A

events.name: timer_time
events.comment: is the player currently answering a question?

events.name: drag_time
events.comment: is the user currently draggin and droppin

events.name: drag_check
events.comment: total items that can be dragged - correct or incorrect

events.name: drag_correct
events.comment: number of items that are the correct answer

events.name: dragDone
events.comment: is the user done with the drag & drop section

actions.text: So basically we need to move all the objects as well from this part. The UI stuff is left untouched

events.text: To send the player to the next screen
If the right answer is chosen

parameters: "You and 18% other users chose:"
"Public transport is one of the greenest ways to get around - and taking the train means we have more time to be scrolling on tiktok doesn’t it?"
"Taking the train reduces your greenhouse gas emissions by 80% as opposed to driving a car. "
"You and 18% other users chose:"

"That’s right! Most recycling centres usually end up discarding a lot of waste because it is not sorted correctly. Let’s make it our shared responsibility to remember to put the right recyclables into the right bins. "

"About 113,200 aluminium cans are recycled per minute! Recycling cans are fairly cheap, fast and widely practised - a recycled aluminium can will be recycled, processed and back on the shelves from as fast as 60 days. "
"You and 18% other users chose:"

"#SapotLokal all the way! Local ingredients reduce the carbon footprint of your groceries, since they are grown and packaged nearer to you. They are also fresher, more accessible and support the local economy."
"Some food producers are experimenting putting a ‘carbon footprint’ tag on every item so consumers like us are aware and encouraged to make more eco-friendly shopping choices."
"You and 18% other users chose:"
"Way to go! Take out those cool reusable shopping bags with pride."
"This year, some supermarkets in Malaysia have started a commitment for zero-single use plastic bags at checkouts. "
"You and 18% other users chose:"
"By repairing and repurposing our clothes, we get to hold on longer to the clothes we love and reduce the amount of waste sent to landfill yearly. "
"In 2018, Malaysians threw away roughly 195,300 tonnes of fabric waste. That’s almost two times the weight of Menara KL!"
"You and 18% other users chose:"
"When recycling cans and plastics, make sure to remove any food waste and properly rinse and dry the container before recycling them."

"There are many types of plastic categories, but in Malaysia we can currently only recycle three types: PET 1, PET 2 and PET 5. Check the label on your container before putting them into the recycling bins."

events.text: If the wrong answer is chosen

parameters: "You and 18% other users chose:"
"Awesome - we need more carpoolers like you. With more than a single passenger in each car we have an excuse to car-aoke our way into the city and reduce the emissions of our journey too."

"-If you carpool at least twice a week for a whole year, you can help avoid more than 700kg of greenhouse gas emissions. 
-An average small-sized car emits 200g of carbon dioxide for every kilometer driven."
"You and 18% other users chose:"

"Unfortunately, that’s incorrect. Most recycling centres usually end up discarding a lot of waste because it is not sorted correctly. Let’s make it our shared responsibility to remember to put the right recyclables into the right bins."
"Aluminium cans that aren’t recycled usually end up in landfills where it will take about 500 years for the can to break down and degrade. "
"You and 18% other users chose:"

"Sometimes we forget to bring our own shopping bags with us, but let’s make a pledge to keep at least one reusable shopping bag with us at all times."

"The impact of plastic bags on the environment is high. Plastic bags mostly end up in landfills, taking 300 years to break down, and slowly releasing toxic chemicals into the soil and air while they decompose. "
"You and 18% other users chose:"

"It can take a lot of natural resources to produce textiles for clothing. Roughly 10,000 litres of water is required to produce a single pair of jeans. By repairing and repurposing our clothes, we get to hold on longer to the clothes we love and reduce the amount of waste sent to landfill yearly. "

"Reusing plastic containers is an effective and cheap tip that people can adopt to reduce plastic waste. We can reuse these safely about 25 times before it loses durability and becomes unsafe for use. "

"You and your two housemates decide to spend the day in the city. You are at Sentral Station. Which option would you take to get into the city?"
"A: Carpool"
"B: Walk to the station and take the train"

"We’re walking around a pop-up market selling local treats and trinkets. You purchase a canned drink and continue to check out the rest of the market stalls. You’ve finished your drink, rinsed the can and you’re about to put it into the recycling bin. Which is the correct bin to recycle an aluminium can?"
"General Waste"
"Bottles & Cans"

"Let’s head over to the groceries section to top up this week’s set of groceries. There are so many products that come from a lot of different sources, near and far. Which is the more sustainable option for buying goods? "
"A: Choose the produce imported from all around the world."
"B: Choose the locally-produced  variety with locally-sourced ingredients. "

"Let’s head over to the groceries section to top up this week’s set of groceries. There are so many products that come from a lot of different sources, near and far. Which is the more sustainable option for buying goods?"
"A: Choose the produce imported from all around the world."
"B: Choose the locally-produced  variety with locally-sourced ingredients."
"Tip #1: To waste is in poor taste"
"Bring your own reusable bottle with you when you travel. Most restaurants and cafes will gladly refill your bottle for you, and some will even offer you a little discount on your drink too!"
"Tip #2: Let’s ride against climate change"
"Having walkways and bike lanes in our neighborhood encourages walking and cycling. These are low-carbon choices that will reduce emissions in the city."
"Tip #3: Meat free mondays everyday?"

"Most of our dietary choices still include meat options, but were you aware that different meats emit more carbon than others? Lamb is the most carbon-intensive meat, followed by beef, pork, chicken, then fish."
"Tip #4: Be your own (urban) farmer"

"Have a try at growing your own fruit and vegetables, simple starter-kits can be purchased from local urban farmers. The produce would be organic since you won’t be using the harmful chemicals that are usually used in commercial agriculture, and it’s actually fairly simple to maintain! 
"
"Tip #5: Food for thought… "

"If you have leftovers or even extra groceries for the week, here are some tips towards living a zero-waste lifestyle when it comes to food:
- Repurpose your leftovers the next day into a brand new dish!
-Freeze your groceries to preserve them a little longer."
